If you are on linux (maybe also macOS), you could copy to the clipboard and then run this in your terminal
`xclip -o sel clip | wc -m | awk '{print 5000 - $1}'` (assuming xclip and awk are installed)

text: So, I think there's something else going on here as well.  The file I copied/pasted was just a hair under 5000, but yet, when I tried to save it, it gave red outline.  I had to remove almost 200, bringing it to ~4800 before it'd save.  Something odd; I didn't save our initial sample, to report as a bug, but, it was frustrating.
